items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  7.02
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Excuse Absence of Board Clerk Van Le from the May 31, 2011, Special Board Meeting (Education Code Section 35120)
	 
	 
The Board of Trustees were informed that Board Clerk Van Le will be absent from the May 31, 2011, Board meeting. 
	 
Per Education Code section 35120(c), a Board Member who is absent from a meeting may receive his/her monthly stipend if the Board adopts a resolution finding that the Board member was absent to a hardship.
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Administration recommends that the Board resolve and find that Clerk Van Le's absence was due to a hardship and that the Board excuse her absence from the May 31, 2011, Special Board Meeting.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
		 
Item:  8.01
		 
		 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Kirsten King, Director of Instructional Services
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education Students
		 
		 
DESCRIPTION:  
Education Code Section 60851 states that students who take one or both parts of the CAHSEE with a modification and receive the equivalent of a passing score are eligible for the waiver request process.  At the request of the student's parent or guardian, a school principal must submit to the local school governing board a request for a waiver of the requirement to pass the part(s) of the CASHEE on which a modification was used and the equivalent of a passing score was earned.  For the local board to waive the CASHEE requirement, the principal must certify to the local board that the pupil has all of the following:
An individualized education program adopted pursuant to the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act or a plan adopted pursuant to Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 that requires the accommodations or modifications to be provided to the pupil when taking the high school exit examination.
Sufficient high school level coursework either satisfactorily completed or in progress in a high school level curriculum sufficient to have attained the skills and knowledge otherwise needed to pass the high school exit examination.
An individual score report for the pupil showing that the pupil has received the equivalent of a passing score on the high school exit examination measures as determined by the State Board of Education.
The waivers were requested by the school site administration on behalf of the students' parents.
		 
The recommended waivers meet the aforementioned criteria delineated in the Education Code 60851:
		 
Student A
Student B
Student C
Student D
Student E
Student F
Student G
Student H
Student I
Student J
Student K

Student TT

Student VV
Student WW
Student XX
Student YY
Student ZZ
Student AAA
					 
		 
FISCAL IMPACT
N/A
		 
FUNDING SOURCE
N/A
		 
RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the recommended waivers.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
					 
Item:  9.01
					 
TO:
Board of Trustees
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
								 
								 
PREPARED BY:
Hardy Childers, Interim Associate Superintendent of Business Services
								 
								 
SUBJECT:
Presentation/Accept Cash and Fund Balance Projection (Third Interim Financial Report) 
					 
					 
The Interim Associate Superintendent of Business Services will present a financial report relating to the 2010-11 budget year and a multi-year projection through 2012-13.  This report is required by the State of all school districts filing a Second Interim Report which was certified as “qualified,” indicating that the school district may not be able to meet its financial obligations through the term of the multi-year projection.  At the time of the Second Interim Report, projections indicated that the District would face a shortfall of approximately $5 million in meeting the State reserve requirements in 2012-13.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
		 
Item:  10.01
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Hardy Childers, Interim Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Approve Form Professional Services Agreements for Measure E and Measure G
		 
		 
Attached is the contract form for Architectural Services for Board approval (attachment to be provided separately).  
		 
The contract form for Inspection Services has been revised to reflect the comments received from the Board at the May 10, 2011, Regular Meeting.  Although DSA closeout of every project requires the cooperation and coordination between multiple professionals (e.g., architects, construction managers, inspectors, engineers), primary responsibility lies with the architect of record.  To balance the varying degrees of responsibility with the District's interest in attracting and maintaining high quality professional service provider and maintaining fairness and accountability in the process, Administration recommends a retention of 3% in connection with the Inspector of Record contract.
		 
		 
FISCAL IMPACT:
N/A
		 
FUNDING SOURCE:
N/A
		 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the form Professional Services Agreements for Inspection Services and Architectural Services for Measure E and Measure G.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
				 
Item:  11.07
TO:
Board of Trustees
							 
							 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
							 
							 
PREPARED BY:
Hardy Childers, Interim Associate Superintendent of Business Services
							 
							 
SUBJECT:
Approve Amended Change Order #1 for W.C. Overfelt and Yerba Buena High Schools, Kitchen Renovation Projects (Calstate Construction, Inc.)
				 
				 
At the April 15, 2010 Board meeting, Facilities and Planning submitted a change order for the subject project showing the reconciliation of the contracted bid amount including the 10% allowance.  However, at that time there was still one outstanding issue that needed to be resolved with the General Contractor.  It was not until recently did the General Contractor and ESUHSD reach settlement on the unresolved issue.  This amended change order is being submitted to the Board for approval. However, the total amount of this change does not exceed the amount on the purchasing order but does require Board approval so that Administration can move money from a closed purchase order to pay the additional settled amount of $4,000.00. The amended change is highlighted in red.
				 
				 
FISCAL IMPACT:
As indicated in the attachment
				 
FUNDING SOURCE:
As indicated in the attachment
				 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the amended change #1 for W.C. Overfelt and Yerba Buena High Schools, Kitchen Renovation Projects.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  12.01
				 
					 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jon Reinke, Chairperson of Measure G and Measure E Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) 2010 Annual Report
	 
	 
	 
Attached is the Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) 2010 Annual Report.
	 
Based on the information presented to the Committee, the Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee of the East Side Union High School District has determined that Measure G and Measure E Bond funds have been expended only on construction, reconstruction, rehabilitation, replacement, or purchase of school facilities, and that the Performance and Financial audits required under Proposition 39 have been conducted by the District.
	 
However, the Committee also believes that in order to increase taxpayer confidence that the District spends bond money appropriately and efficiently, the District should continue to improve its Audit and Financial Controls processes as recommended by the County Office of Education.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
N/A
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
N/A
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
N/A
